title: Area individual statistical leaders (Oct. 20)
text:
Area individual statistical leaders (Oct. 20) 
The stats for area teams after Week 8 have been compiled 
Conway’s Derrick closing in on school mark Conway’s Peyton Derrick has 25 total touchdowns this season. JASON LEE jlee@thesunnews.com i Order Reprint of this Story 
Peyton Derrick is closing in on Conway’s all-time single-season passing yards mark. 
The Tigers quarterback can points to top receiver Bryan Edwards or the handful of other speedsters he’s relied upon to throw to all year. But the overall effectiveness that has him in third place in the school’s record book since Chuck Jordan took over may be his ability to keep the ball in his own team’s hands. 
Of Derrick’s 192 pass attempts this year, only two have resulted in interceptions. That equates to 1.04 percent of his attempts, a ridiculously small figure given the fact that Conway has thrown the ball as much as it has this year. 
With his performance last week against Socastee, Derrick moved past his 2014 figures. He now stands only behind his older brother Dakota Derrick, who threw for 2,471 yards in 2007 and 2,410 yards in 2006. Rushing
